question.title: What does exactly `operator` keyword do in kotlin?
question.body:
today i saw a code which had a operator keyword in it, I went through kotlin docs and as i went more into it, i couldn't understand what exatly operator keyword do. Can somebody explain it to me in a clean way?!

this is the code:

class ImageUseCase @Inject constructor(private val repository: GeneralDataSource) {
    suspend operator fun invoke(
        page: Int = 1,
        category: String = "latest"
    ) = repository.getAllImages(
        page = page,
        category = category
    )
}

thanks in advance. i'm new to kotlin!
